subject: ComfyUI-Custom-Scripts Installation
question: What is the process to install ComfyUI-Custom-Scripts?
answer: To install ComfyUI-Custom-Scripts, clone the repository to your ComfyUI `custom_nodes` directory using the command `git clone https://github.com/pythongosssss/ComfyUI-Custom-Scripts.git`.

subject: ComfyUI-Custom-Scripts Uninstallation
question: How can I uninstall ComfyUI-Custom-Scripts?
answer: For uninstallation, delete the cloned repo from your ComfyUI `custom_nodes` directory and ensure `web/extensions/pysssss/CustomScripts` has also been removed.

subject: ComfyUI-Custom-Scripts Update
question: What are the steps to update ComfyUI-Custom-Scripts?
answer: To update ComfyUI-Custom-Scripts, navigate to the cloned repo and pull the latest changes using the commands `cd custom_nodes/ComfyUI-Custom-Scripts` and `git pull`.

subject: ComfyUI-Custom-Scripts Features
question: What features are included in ComfyUI-Custom-Scripts?
answer: Features include Autocomplete, Auto Arrange Graph, Always Snap to Grid, Better Loader Lists (with custom Lora and Checkpoint loader nodes), Checkpoint/LoRA/Embedding Info, Constrain Image, Custom Colors, Favicon Status, Image Feed, KSampler (Advanced) denoiser helper, Lock Nodes & Groups, Math Expression, Node Finder, Preset Text, Quick Nodes, Play Sound, [WIP] Repeater, Show Text, Show Image on Menu, String Function, Touch Support, Widget Defaults, Workflows, and Workflow Images.

subject: ComfyUI-Custom-Scripts Workflow Images
question: How can I import or export the graph as SVG and PNG showing a view of the nodes?
answer: Use the menu options for importing/exporting the graph as SVG and PNG, provided in the Workflows section of ComfyUI-Custom-Scripts.

subject: ComfyUI-Custom-Scripts Reroute Primitive
question: What is the purpose of the Reroute Primitive in ComfyUI-Custom-Scripts?
answer: The Reroute Primitive provides a node that allows rerouting primitives. It can also be collapsed to a single point that you can drag around.

subject: ComfyUI-Custom-Scripts Show Text
question: What does the Show Text node in ComfyUI-Custom-Scripts do?
answer: The Show Text node takes input from a node that produces a string and displays it, useful for things like interrogator, prompt generators, etc.

subject: ComfyUI-Custom-Scripts Lock Nodes & Groups
question: Can I prevent moving nodes in ComfyUI-Custom-Scripts until they are unlocked?
answer: Yes, you can add a lock option to nodes & groups that prevents you from moving them until unlocked.

subject: ComfyUI-Custom-Scripts Autocomplete
question: What does the Autocomplete feature in ComfyUI-Custom-Scripts provide?
answer: The Autocomplete feature provides embedding and custom word autocomplete. You can view embedding details by clicking on the info icon on the list.

subject: ComfyUI-Custom-Scripts Math Expression
question: What types of values can be input in the Math Expression node?
answer: The Math Expression node supports input values of INT, FLOAT, IMAGE, and LATENT.

subject: ComfyUI-Custom-Scripts String Function
question: What does the String Function node in ComfyUI-Custom-Scripts do?
answer: The String Function node supports appending and replacing text. It also supports tidying tags and replacing text using regex.

subject: ComfyUI-Custom-Scripts Better Loader Lists
question: What does the Better Loader Lists feature in ComfyUI-Custom-Scripts add?
answer: The Better Loader Lists feature adds custom LoRA and Checkpoint loader nodes, which have the ability to show preview images.

subject: ComfyUI-Custom-Scripts Changelog
question: Where can I find the changes made to the ComfyUI-Custom-Scripts?
answer: You can find the changes made in the Changelog section of the ComfyUI-Custom-Scripts GitHub repository.
